vision: A unified dashboard for developers to track and manage all their local coding projects at a glance

target_audience.primary: Solo developers or small teams who manage multiple local coding projects and want a visual dashboard to track project status, Git state, and activity
secondary: Freelance developers with many client projects
Open source contributors managing multiple repositories
Development team leads who need project health visibility

phases.name: Foundation & Core Usability
phases.description: Complete the MVP by adding essential search, filter, and sorting capabilities that make the dashboard usable at scale

milestones.title: Search & Discovery
milestones.description: Users can quickly find any project using search and filters

milestones.title: Content Enhancement
milestones.description: Project details are presented beautifully with proper formatting

phases.name: Organization & Workflow
phases.description: Add features that help users organize projects and streamline their daily workflow

milestones.title: Project Organization
milestones.description: Users can categorize, tag, and prioritize their projects

milestones.title: Power User Features
milestones.description: Keyboard shortcuts and batch operations for efficient navigation

phases.name: Performance & Scale
phases.description: Optimize performance for users with large numbers of projects and improve reliability

milestones.title: Performance Optimization
milestones.description: Dashboard loads instantly with caching and pagination

phases.name: Advanced Features & Polish
phases.description: Add advanced customization, notifications, and personalization features

milestones.title: Personalization
milestones.description: Users can customize their dashboard experience

milestones.title: Proactive Insights
milestones.description: Dashboard proactively alerts users to projects needing attention

features.title: Project Search
features.description: Add a global search bar that allows users to quickly find projects by name, description, or path. Search should be instant with real-time filtering as the user types.
features.rationale: Users with many projects struggle to locate specific ones. Search addresses the pain point of 'no easy way to see at-a-glance status of all local projects' and reduces time spent scrolling through project lists.
acceptance_criteria: Search bar is prominently displayed in the dashboard header
Search filters projects in real-time as user types
Search matches against project name, path, and description
Search works in both grid and table view modes
user_stories: As a developer with 50+ projects, I want to search by name so that I can find a specific project in seconds
As a freelancer, I want to search by client name in the path so that I can quickly find client projects

features.title: Status Filters
features.description: Add filter buttons or a filter panel to show only projects matching specific statuses (active, stale, clean, dirty, unknown). Allow multiple filters to be combined.
features.rationale: Users need to quickly identify which projects need attention. This directly addresses 'losing track of which projects have uncommitted changes' by letting users filter to only dirty projects.
acceptance_criteria: Filter buttons for each status type (active, stale, clean, dirty, unknown)
Clicking a filter shows only projects with that status
Multiple filters can be combined (e.g., show dirty AND stale)
Clear all filters button is available
user_stories: As a developer, I want to filter by 'dirty' status so that I can see all projects with uncommitted changes at once
As a developer, I want to filter by 'stale' status so that I can identify projects I've neglected

features.title: Sorting Options
features.description: Add a sort dropdown to organize projects by different criteria: name (A-Z, Z-A), last modified date, status, and project type. Currently only sorts by last modified.
features.rationale: Different tasks require different sorting. When reviewing all projects alphabetically helps; when looking for recent work, date sorting helps. This improves the user's ability to quickly scan and find relevant projects.
acceptance_criteria: Sort dropdown with options: Name (A-Z), Name (Z-A), Last Modified (Newest), Last Modified (Oldest), Status, Type
Current sort selection is clearly indicated
Works in both grid and table view modes
user_stories: As a developer, I want to sort projects alphabetically so that I can easily scan through my project list
As a developer, I want to sort by status so that I can see all dirty projects grouped together

features.title: Markdown README Rendering
features.description: Render project README files with proper Markdown formatting instead of displaying as pre-formatted text. Support headings, code blocks, links, lists, and images.
features.rationale: README files are written in Markdown and should be displayed properly. This helps users 'remember what each project does when returning after time away' by presenting documentation beautifully.
acceptance_criteria: README content is rendered as formatted Markdown
Headings, bold, italic, and strikethrough render correctly
Links are clickable and open in new tab
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see my README rendered properly so that I can quickly understand what a project does
As a developer, I want code examples in README to be syntax highlighted so that I can read them easily

features.title: Favorite/Pinned Projects
features.description: Allow users to mark projects as favorites. Favorited projects appear at the top of the list or in a dedicated 'Favorites' section for quick access.
features.rationale: Users have a small set of projects they work on regularly. Pinning these reduces the 'context-switching between projects' pain point by putting frequent projects front and center.
acceptance_criteria: Star/pin icon on each project card
Favorite projects appear at the top of the list
user_stories: As a developer, I want to pin my active projects so that I can access them immediately when I open the dashboard
As a freelancer, I want to favorite current client projects so that they're always visible

features.title: Project Tags & Categories
features.description: Allow users to add custom tags to projects and filter by tags. Tags could include 'work', 'personal', 'client-name', 'hackathon', etc.
features.rationale: Projects often belong to different contexts (work, personal, client). Tags help users 'remember what each project does' and organize projects beyond what the filesystem provides.
acceptance_criteria: Add tag button on project cards and detail pages
Tag input with autocomplete from existing tags
Tags display as colored chips on project cards
Filter dropdown/panel to filter by tags
Multiple tags can be assigned to one project
Tags persist across sessions (localStorage or config file)
user_stories: As a freelancer, I want to tag projects with client names so that I can filter to see all projects for a specific client
As a developer, I want to tag projects as 'work' or 'personal' so that I can focus on the right context

features.title: Global Keyboard Shortcuts
features.description: Add keyboard shortcuts for common actions: search (Cmd+K), refresh (Cmd+R), toggle view mode (V), navigate projects (arrow keys), open selected project (Enter).
features.rationale: Power users want to navigate without touching the mouse. Keyboard shortcuts significantly speed up navigation and reduce the 'context-switching is tedious' pain point.
acceptance_criteria: Cmd/Ctrl + K opens search with focus
V toggles between grid and table view
Enter opens selected project detail page
user_stories: As a power user, I want to press Cmd+K to quickly search so that I never need to reach for the mouse
As a developer, I want to navigate with arrow keys so that I can quickly browse through projects

features.title: Project Notes & Custom Metadata
features.description: Allow users to add personal notes to projects. Notes could include TODO items, current status, or context for when returning to the project later.
features.rationale: README files are for documentation, but users often need personal notes like 'waiting on API access' or 'next: implement auth'. This directly addresses 'hard to remember what each project does when returning after time away'.
acceptance_criteria: Notes text area on project detail page
Notes preview visible on project cards (truncated)
Notes are searchable via global search
user_stories: As a developer, I want to add notes to a project so that I remember what I was working on when I return
As a freelancer, I want to note client requirements so that I don't forget important details

features.title: Project Caching
features.description: Cache project scan results to avoid re-scanning on every page load. Implement smart cache invalidation based on file system changes or manual refresh.
features.rationale: Currently project scanning runs on every page load, which is slow with many projects. Caching significantly improves perceived performance and reduces resource usage.
acceptance_criteria: Projects load instantly from cache on page load
Cache invalidates when user clicks refresh
Background refresh option to update cache silently
Cache stored in memory or filesystem
Visual indicator when showing cached vs fresh data
user_stories: As a developer with 100 projects, I want the dashboard to load instantly so that I don't wait for scanning
As a user, I want to know when I'm seeing cached data so that I can refresh if needed

features.title: Pagination
features.description: Implement pagination or virtual scrolling for users with large numbers of projects. Show a configurable number of projects per page with navigation controls.
features.rationale: Users with 100+ projects will experience slow rendering and overwhelming UI. Pagination keeps the dashboard responsive and organized at scale.
acceptance_criteria: Projects display in pages of configurable size (default: 20)
Pagination controls at bottom of project list
Current page number and total pages displayed
URL updates to reflect current page (for bookmarking)
user_stories: As a developer with many projects, I want pagination so that the dashboard remains fast and usable
As a user, I want to configure how many projects to show so that I can balance density and performance

features.title: Unit & Integration Tests
features.description: Add comprehensive test coverage using Jest and React Testing Library. Cover utility functions, components, and critical user flows.
features.rationale: The project currently has no test coverage. Tests are essential for maintaining quality and enabling confident refactoring as the codebase grows.
acceptance_criteria: Jest and React Testing Library configured
Unit tests for utility functions (git helpers, status logic)
Component tests for key UI components
Integration tests for project scanning flow
user_stories: As a developer, I want test coverage so that I can refactor with confidence
As a contributor, I want tests so that I know my changes don't break existing functionality

features.title: Error Handling Improvements
features.description: Enhance error handling with better error messages, retry capabilities, and graceful degradation when individual projects fail to scan.
features.rationale: When a project fails to scan (e.g., permissions issues), the error should be clear and not affect other projects. This improves reliability and user trust.
acceptance_criteria: Individual project scan failures don't affect other projects
Clear error messages explain what went wrong
Retry button for failed project scans
Error state visually distinct on project cards
Error details accessible in project detail page
user_stories: As a developer, I want clear error messages so that I can understand and fix issues
As a user, I want one failed project to not break my entire dashboard

features.title: Dashboard Customization
features.description: Allow users to customize the dashboard layout: default view mode, visible columns in table view, card density, and which status cards to show.
features.rationale: Different users have different preferences. Customization lets users optimize their workflow and makes the dashboard feel personalized.
user_stories: As a user, I want to customize my dashboard so that it shows exactly what I need
As a developer, I want to hide status cards I don't care about so that I can focus

features.title: Project Archive/Hide
features.description: Allow users to archive or hide projects they no longer want to see in the main dashboard. Archived projects remain scannable but are hidden by default.
features.rationale: Users accumulate old projects over time. Archiving keeps the dashboard focused on active work without deleting projects from the filesystem.
acceptance_criteria: Archive action available on project cards
Archived projects hidden from main view by default
user_stories: As a developer, I want to archive old projects so that my dashboard stays focused on current work
As a user, I want to unarchive a project if I return to it

features.title: Status Change Notifications
features.description: Detect when project status changes (e.g., becomes dirty or stale) and optionally notify the user via browser notifications or a notifications panel.
features.rationale: This directly addresses 'losing track of which projects have uncommitted changes' by proactively alerting users rather than requiring them to check.
user_stories: As a developer, I want to be notified when a project has uncommitted changes so that I don't forget to commit
As a user, I want to configure which notifications I receive so that I'm not overwhelmed

features.title: Recent Projects Widget
features.description: Add a 'Recently Opened' section showing the last 5-10 projects the user viewed or opened. Quick access to recent context.
features.rationale: Users often switch between a small set of projects. A recent projects widget provides one-click access to commonly used projects without searching.
acceptance_criteria: Recent projects section on dashboard (sidebar or top)
user_stories: As a developer, I want quick access to recent projects so that I can resume where I left off
As a user, I want to see what projects I was working on recently
